hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Breakout via 20D Volatility Compression
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and BTC's 20-day realized volatility compresses below 35% while price consolidates within a 5% range for 10 days, a breakout above the consolidation high on >1.5x average volume will signal a transition to a BULL regime with an average forward 5-day return of +4.2%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low-volatility consolidation in neutral regimes often precedes directional moves. A high-volume breakout from compression suggests institutional accumulation and regime change initiation.
entry_conditions: BTC price range (high-low)/low < 5% over past 10 days
BTC closes > consolidation high (10-day max) on volume > 1.5x 20D avg volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% gain from entry OR regime shifts to BULL (confidence > 70%)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such breakouts fail to sustain (close back inside range within 3 days) OR forward 5-day returns are not statistically positive (p > 0.05).
